thread.title: Trump’s Nominees Face Tough Sledding in Senate

author: Natalie Andrews
title: Trump’s Nominees Face Tough Sledding in Senate
text:
WASHINGTON—A procedural vote to advance the president’s nomination for NASA administrator thrust the normally scripted Senate into a temporary but tense stalemate Wednesday, when a Republican senator cast a vote against the nominee, Rep. James Bridenstine.

Sen. Jeff Flake (R., Ariz.) eventually changed his vote to yes, allowing the nomination of Mr. Bridenstine, an Oklahoma Republican, to move forward. But for more than a half-hour, the vote stood at 49-49, putting the chamber in a state of limbo. Normally a tie vote could...
